intro: Anagallis arvensis, commonly known as the mouse-ear or redmaids, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Primulaceae. It is an annual herb that typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant features small, spurred flowers that are usually pink or red, with five petals and a distinctive nectar spur. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and hairy, while its stems are erect and branched. Anagallis arvensis is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas across Europe and parts of Asia.
